comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Monsieur Google kindly suggests that the photograph came from the studio of Monsieur [?Alfonso] Le Tourneux of 249 Regent Road, Salford... www.flickr.com/photos/15651285@N08/1744602713/in/photolis... M. Le Tourneux appears to have also been located just up the street at one point... www.specialistmedals.com/downloads/John_Wilson_Humane_Soc... link parked here for possible future reference...possibly a herring though... www.weasteheritagetrail.co.uk/salford-people/biographies/... the last para here mentions "Mr and Mrs R.M. Whitehead (Superintendent and Matron of Salford Baths)"...there's a good lead! www.salfordcommunityleisure.co.uk/sites/default/files/upl... See Geoff Swallow's article on 19th century English swimmer J.J. Collier (p. 19) ...I wonder whether Geoff might be able to help with this one... To this point (now well past my bed time!) it appears that Mrs Whitehead and her husband ran the Salford baths...he was a swimmer of some standing and I suspect she might have been as well...that might well be Mrs Whitehead who we see holding the shield in this pic... www.bathsandwashhouses.co.uk/archive/your-local-buildings... these Salford baths remind me of [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3794325206/] www.tyldesleyswimming.co.uk/index_htm_files/1877-1903.pdf 1884 Gala program advises: "Mrs R.M.Whitehead - 'The most accomplished Lady Swimmer in the World' will give an Exhibition in 'Ornamental and Scientific Swimming' " (!) I wonder whether the badges/medals they're wearing can be identified...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Great stuff! Thanks Quasymody, interesting re the Whiteheads. I've sent the image to one of the local history societies - hopefully they can use it!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I'm sure they'll be interested...they might even be able to tell us more of the story...
